info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 18 at 11:43PM CDT until August 19 at 10:30AM CDT by NWS Chicago IL
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is occurring.
* WHERE...A portion of northeast Illinois, including the following county, Kendall.
* WHEN...Until 1030 AM CDT Tuesday.
* IMPACTS...Creeks and streams may rise out of their banks. Low-lying areas such as fields and ditches may be flooded. Roadways may be flooded, as well.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1142 PM CDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicate that between 2 and 4 inches of rain has fallen in the area. It will take time for flood waters to recede. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Aurora, Joliet, Plainfield, Oswego, Yorkville, Minooka, Plano, Sandwich, Montgomery, Boulder Hill, Newark, Millington, Millbrook, Lisbon, Plattville, Bristol and Little Rock. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: A Flood Advisory means minor flooding along waterways and other poor drainage areas is imminent or may already be occurring. Persons in the advisory area should use caution and avoid flood waters.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1030 AM CDT TUESDAY
